sense.gloss: to eat
to live on (e.g. a salary), to live off, to subsist on
food, foodstuff
prey, victim
to eat
to live, to make a living, to survive
to bite, to sting (as insects do)
to tease, to torment, to taunt, to make light of, to make fun of
to encroach on, to eat into, to consume
to defeat a superior, to threaten a position
to consume time and-or resources
to receive something (usu. an unfavourable event)
to have sexual relations with a woman, esp. for the first time
to happen to meet, to come across
to eat, to drink, to wolf, to knock back
to receive (e.g. a blow)
to be on the receiving end (of something undesirable), to undergo (trouble)
mortar, plaster, stucco
unable to stomach, sticking in one's throat, displeased with
anteater
to bite at, to snap at, to nibble
x: 食いつく・くいつく・1

sense.gloss: to get one's teeth into (metaphorically), to get to grips with, to really get into
x: 食いつく・くいつく・2

sense.gloss: cannibalism, biting (someone)
man-eating (e.g. tiger), cannibalistic

sdata.j: この↑土地↑↓とち↓の↑人↑↓ひと↓は、この↑川↑↓かわ↓を、↑人↑↓ひと↓↑喰↑↓く↓い↑川↑↓かわ↓と↑呼↑↓よ↓んで、↑恐怖↑↓きょうふ↓している。
sdata.e: The locals call this river the man-eating river and fear it.

sdata.j: ↑僕↑↓ぼく↓が↑昼飯↑↓ひるめし↓を↑喰↑↓く↓っている↑時↑↓とき↓、↑吉弥↑↓よしや↓は↑僕↑↓ぼく↓のところへやって↑来↑↓き↓て、↑飯↑↓めし↓の↑給仕↑↓きゅうじ↓をしてくれながら↑太↑↓ふと↓い↑指↑↓ゆび↓にきらめいている↑宝石↑↓ほうせき↓↑入↑↓い↓りの↑指輪↑↓ゆびわ↓を↑嬉↑↓うれ↓しそうにいじくっていた。
sdata.e: As I was eating lunch, Kichiya came to me and, while she was serving my meal, she was toying happily with her ring set with a gleaming jewel.

sdata.j: ↑森↑↓もり↓に↑行↑↓い↓ったら、↑人↑↓ひと↓↑喰↑↓く↓い↑鬼↑↓おに↓に↑気↑↓き↓をつけてください！
sdata.e: If you go into the forest, watch out for the man-eating ogres!

sdata.j: これで、↑真面目↑↓まじめ↓な↑人↑↓ひと↓も↑喰↑↓く↓いついてくれるかな。
sdata.e: I wonder if people who are serious about it will also dig their teeth into this?

sdata.j: ↑喰↑↓く↓え。ボーッとしてないで。
チャーハンが↑喰↑↓く↓いてー。
sdata.e: I want to eat fried rice.
